Nope, although I respect your opinion, I decided not to do that long before I even posted the images. To me, it made sense that the flight crew should have something special - such as flight wings added to their badges. NASA did this for the Astronauts - even the civilian ones - for the hat-tip to the hard physical demands placed on flight crews during training and the actual mission. So, I kept that bit of realism.

I did put a wreath and star on the mission director for the simple reason - I thought it looked cool, The only other name badge where I thought any symbol was needed was the flight surgeon, because under NACA, NASA's precedent, the flight surgeon was always either a U.S. Navy or U.S. Air Force physician with the rank of Brigadier General. Since NACA was to be a civilian agency with military personnel working at it, the medical caduceus was used to indicate the position.

To add a special graphic to each and every one would not only take away from the crisp and clean looks of the images, but would also cause the text to become condensed in some cases. Most of the clip art for the images you suggest would also look a bit cartoon-ish, something I try to avoid.

When I initially posted the first signature images - beyond the mission patch, those were meant as gravy for everyone involved. These were never requested by ZooNamedGames, but something I did on my own. Freebies, if you will. If you don't like them, then don't use them or I can always delete them if they become an issue of contention for those involved with the project.

These are just my thoughts on the matter. Edited November 20, 2015 by adsii1970
